poem:
Title: Strains of Davos Echo

Knocking on the common world's door,
CEOs, Macron, Blinken pour -
Thoughts into the Davos core.

Quick coffee sip, then Lagarde's sounding,
European pulse robust, resounding:
"Friends across oceans notwithstanding,
Our strength lies within our own grounding."

In this global game of thrones,
Each bird sings in its own tones,
The world revolves, nobody's alone.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Davos day two: Rachel Reeves pitches to CEOs; Blinken, Guterres, Macron and Milei to speak – business live 8.43am GMT On US election, Lagarde says Europeans must be strong ECB president Christine Lagarde was also asked about this year’s US elections. And after a quick swig of coffee, she replies: “We have to be strong as Europeans and not assume that we can rely on whoever our friends are around the world, because that can". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
